DOC.criteria: Healthy subject determine result screen Written inform consent accord good clinical practice ( GCP ) local legislation Age > =18 < =50 year Broca > = 20 % < = +20 % Any finding medical examination ( blood pressure , pulse rate electrocardiogram ( ECG ) ) deviate normal clinical relevance Gastrointestinal , hepatic , renal , respiratory , cardiovascular , metabolic , immunological hormonal disorder Surgery gastrointestinal tract ( except appendectomy ) Disease central nervous system ( epilepsy ) psychiatric disorder neurological disorder History orthostatic hypotension , faint spell blackouts Chronic relevant acute infection History allergy/hypersensitivity ( include drug allergy ) deem relevant trial judge investigator Intake drug long halflife ( > 24h ) ( < =1month prior administration ) Use drug might influence result trial ( < =10 day prior administration trial ) Participation another trial investigational drug ( < = 2 month prior administration trial ) Smokers ( > 10 cigarette > 3 cigar > 3 pipes/day ) Inability refrain smoke trial day Alcohol abuse ( > 60g/day ) Drug abuse Blood donation ( < = 1 month prior administration trial ) Excessive physical activity ( < = 5 day prior administration trial ) Any laboratory value outside reference range clinical relevance History hemorrhagic diatheses History gastrointestinal ulcer , perforation bleed History bronchial asthma For female : Pregnancy Positive pregnancy test No adequate contraception e.g . sterilization , intrauterine device ( IUD ) , oral contraceptive Inability maintain adequate contraception whole study period Lactation period
